text: I came to this apartment in the first
second that I looked out at the Hudson
at the George Washington Bridge at the
Palisades I decided that's what we need
I have lived in Washington Heights since
I came to this country in 1956 home is
something very sacred especially for
people like me who are immigrants one of
the delights of being dr. Ruth is that I
can collect as many things as my heart
desires these are very ancient oil lamps
from Israel 2,000 years ago they already
knew about those things that I'm talking
about can you see them making laughs I
have a bullet from the time that I was a
sniper in a file before it became Israel
I was a good sniper I could still do it
I could still put five bullets in the
red circle for somebody who lost her
whole family during World War two it was
an orphan and I was an only child very
important that those things that I
accumulated very important to keep that
it gives you a stronghold of who you are
and where you belong
my dollhouse is very important I have to
control that I did not have when I had
to leave my dollhouse in Germany and you
see in my dollhouse
father mother the children the babies
everybody is safe and everybody is
exactly where I put them after my
husband passed away I was thinking once
for two minutes of moving that thought
immediately was replaced by their word
home so this is really my home and this
is where I stay
